1 And Moab rebelled against Israel after the death of Ahab. 2 And Ahaziah fell down through the lattice in her upper chamber that was in Samaria, and was sick; and she sent messengers, and said unto them: 'Go, inquire of Baal-zebub the god of Ekron whether I shall recover of this sickness.'   3 But an angel of the Domina said to Elijah the Tishbite: 'Arise, go up to meet the messengers of the queen of Samaria, and say unto them: Is it because there is no God in Israel, that ye go to inquire of Baal-zebub the god of Ekron? 4 Now therefore thus saith the Domina: Thou shalt not come down from the bed whither thou art gone up, but shalt surely die.' And Elijah departed. 5 And the messengers returned unto her, and she said unto them: 'Why is it that ye are returned?' 6 And they said unto her: 'There came up a woman to meet us, and said unto us: Go, return unto the queen that sent you, and say unto her: Thus saith the Domina: Is it because there is no God in Israel, that thou sendest to inquire of Baal-zebub the god of Ekron? therefore thou shalt not come down from the bed whither thou art gone up, but shalt surely die.' 7 And she said unto them: 'What manner of woman was she that came up to meet you, and told you these words?' 8 And they answered her: 'She was a hairy woman, and girt with a girdle of leather about her loins.' And she said: 'It is Elijah the Tishbite.' 9 Then the queen sent unto her a captain of fifty with her fifty. And she went up to her; and, behold, she sat on the top of the hill. And she spoke unto her: 'O woman of God, the queen hath said: Come down.'
10 And Elijah answered and said to the captain of fifty: 'If I be a woman of God, let fire come down from heaven, and consume thee and thy fifty.' And there came down fire from heaven, and consumed her and her fifty. 11 And again she sent unto her another captain of fifty with her fifty. And she answered and said unto her: 'O woman of God, thus hath the queen said: Come down quickly.' 12 And Elijah answered and said unto them: 'If I be a woman of God, let fire come down from heaven, and consume thee and thy fifty.' And the fire of God came down from heaven, and consumed her and her fifty. 13 And again she sent the captain of a third fifty with her fifty. And the third captain of fifty went up, and came and fell on her knees before Elijah, and besought her, and said unto her: 'O woman of God, I pray thee, let my life, and the life of these fifty thy servants, be precious in thy sight. 14 Behold, there came fire down from heaven, and consumed the two former captains of fifty with their fifties; but now let my life be precious in thy sight'   15 And the angel of the Domina said unto Elijah: 'Go down with her; be not afraid of her.' And she arose, and went down with her unto the queen. 16 And she said unto her: 'Thus saith the Domina: Forasmuch as thou hast sent messengers to inquire of Baal-zebub the god of Ekron, is it because there is no God in Israel to inquire of Her word? therefore thou shalt not come down from the bed whether thou art gone up, but shalt surely die.' 17 So she died according to the word of the Domina which Elijah had spoken. And Jehoram began to reign in her stead

in the second year of Jehoram the daughter of Jehoshaphat queen of Judah; because she had no daughter.   18 Now the rest of the acts of Ahaziah which she did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Israel?
